qas.question: Was Athanasius well liked by everyone?
What was he accused of doing to a church?
He was accused of selling grain for what reason?
What did he call his detractors?
What did the term Arian mean to him?

answers.text: Christians who disagreed with his formulation

qas.question: What was he accused of doing to a mosque?
What did he not call his detractors?
What did the term Arian not mean to him?

context: Throughout most of his career, Athanasius had <a0_0>many detractors<a0_0/>. Classical scholar Timothy Barnes relates contemporary allegations against Athanasius: from <a1_0><b6_0>defiling an altar<b6_0/><a1_0/>, to selling Church grain that had been meant to feed the poor for <a2_0>his own personal gain<a2_0/>, and even violence and murder to suppress dissent. Athanasius used "<b7_0>Arian<b7_0/>" to describe both followers of Arius, and as a <b8_0>derogatory polemical term<b8_0/> for <a4_0><b5_0>Christians<b5_0/> who disagreed with his formulation<a4_0/> of the Trinity. Athanasius called many of his opponents "<a3_0>Arian<a3_0/>", except for Miletus.
